Returns: the same Builder instance. This value will never be null.
Throws: if durationMillis is not strictly positive.
setDuration(long).Description: Sets the VolumeShaper duration in milliseconds. If omitted, the default duration is 1 second.

Returns: the same Builder instance.This value will never be null.
Parameters: float: an array of float values representing the time line of the volume curve.This value must never be null.
float: an array of float values representing the amplitude of the volume curve.This value must never be null.
Throws: if times or volumes is invalid.
setCurve(float[], float[]).Description: Sets the volume curve. The volume curve is represented by a set of control points given by two float arrays of equal length, one representing the time (x) coordinates and one corresponding to the volume (y) coordinates. The length must be at least 2 and no greater than @B_android#media#VolumeShaper#Configuration#getMaximumCurvePoints_E@. The volume curve is normalized as follows: time (x) coordinates should be monotonically increasing, from 0.f to 1.f; volume (y) coordinates must be within 0.f to 1.f. The time scale is set by @B_android#media#VolumeShaper#Configuration#Builder#setDuration_E@.
setCurve(float[], float[]).FullName: public VolumeShaper.Configuration.Builder setCurve (float[] times, float[] volumes)

Returns: the same Builder instance. This value will never be null.
Throws: if curve has not been set.
reflectTimes().Description: Reflects the volume curve so that the shaper changes volume from the end to the start.

VolumeShaper.Configuration.Builder().Description: Constructs a new Builder with the defaults.

Returns: the same Builder instance. This value will never be null.
Parameters: float: the target start volume to use.
Throws: if curve has not been set.
scaleToStartVolume(float).Description: Scale the curve start volume to a target value. Keeps the end volume the same. This works best if the volume curve is monotonic.

Parameters: VolumeShaper.Configuration: prototypical configuration which will be reused in the new Builder. This value must never be null.
VolumeShaper.Configuration.Builder(andro.Description: Constructs a new Builder with settings copied from a given VolumeShaper.Configuration.

Returns: the same Builder instance. This value will never be null.
Parameters: float: the target end volume to use.
Throws: if curve has not been set.
scaleToEndVolume(float).Description: Scale the curve end volume to a target value. Keeps the start volume the same. This works best if the volume curve is monotonic.

Returns: the same Builder instance. This value will never be null.
Throws: if curve has not been set.
invertVolumes().Description: Inverts the volume curve so that the max volume becomes the min volume and vice versa.

Returns: a new @B_android#media#VolumeShaper_E@ object. This value will never be null.
Throws: if curve is not properly set.

Returns: the same Builder instance. This value will never be null.
Parameters: int: method of interpolation used for the volume curve. One of @B_android#media#VolumeShaper#Configuration#INTERPOLATOR_TYPE_STEP_E@, @B_android#media#VolumeShaper#Configuration#INTERPOLATOR_TYPE_LINEAR_E@, @B_android#media#VolumeShaper#Configuration#INTERPOLATOR_TYPE_CUBIC_E@, @B_android#media#VolumeShaper#Configuration#INTERPOLATOR_TYPE_CUBIC_MONOTONIC_E@. Value is @B_android#media#VolumeShaper#Configuration#INTERPOLATOR_TYPE_STEP_E@, @B_android#media#VolumeShaper#Configuration#INTERPOLATOR_TYPE_LINEAR_E@, @B_android#media#VolumeShaper#Configuration#INTERPOLATOR_TYPE_CUBIC_E@, or @B_android#media#VolumeShaper#Configuration#INTERPOLATOR_TYPE_CUBIC_MONOTONIC_E@
setInterpolatorType(int).Description: Sets the interpolator type. If omitted the default interpolator type is @B_android#media#VolumeShaper#Configuration#INTERPOLATOR_TYPE_CUBIC_E@.
